definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Tina:However, the sky quickly clears up after the rain.
sentences.chinese: 不过雨下完之后，天空很快就会放晴了。

sentences.english: And the weather forecast two days ago said it would be sunny.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报前两天也说今天会放晴。

sentences.english: It was cloudy this morning. But it has now cleared up.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上天气还阴沉沉的，可现在已经放晴了。

sentences.english: If only it clears up, we'll set off.
sentences.chinese: 只要天一放晴，我们就动身。

sentences.english: The rain belt is moving southward; it will be sunny here eventually.
sentences.chinese: 雨带即将南移，我们这里终于要放晴了。

sentences.english: That means it will clear up.
sentences.chinese: 那意味着天空会放晴了。

sentences.english: Which cloudy morning was followed by a sunny afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 上午多云，下午放晴，这种日子有吗？

sentences.english: It all depends on the weather clearing up.
sentences.chinese: 这完全取决于天气是否会放晴。

sentences.english: Yesterday's forecast reported it'd be fine.
sentences.chinese: 不过，昨天的预报说是会放晴的。

sentences.english: I feel grateful because of the morning sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 感恩，因为晨起的阳光，心情放晴。

sentences.english: The weather forecast says it'll clear up tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 你告诉对方天气预报说明天会放晴。

sentences.english: The rain held up and there's no sign to clear up.
sentences.chinese: 雨依然在下，而且没有放晴的迹象。

sentences.english: We finally got a sunny day after the long raining spell.
sentences.chinese: 过了长长一阵子雨天之后，终于有了放晴的一天。

sentences.english: It says cloudy in the morning, but it'll clear up early in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 天气预报说晨间多雾，不过下午很早就会放晴。

sentences.english: Hope tomorrow weather will be clear up,celebration partry will be held in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 希望明天天气会放晴，庆祝酒会将在花园举行。

definition: Heaven is cooperating (idiom)/the weather is favorable for the planned activity (a variation of 天公不作美|天公不作美[tian1 gong1 bu4 zuo4 mei3])
sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天青|雨过天青[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing1]
(idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
moderate wind, beautiful sun (idiom); fine sunny weather, esp. in springtime
